definition: to meet by chance/to come across/(of a calendar event) to come along/(of an event) to fall on (a particular day)/to fawn upon
to meet again after a long period of separation

sentences.english: Trembling as the wind blew, which told of his joy of reunion to me by the dense aroma of white lotus.
sentences.chinese: 风颤颤，用白荷酽酽的花香告诉我重逢的喜悦。

sentences.english: At last, they met again, at a airport.
sentences.chinese: 终于重遇，在那制造无数离别和重逢的机场。

sentences.english: Stars into the studies abroad, and Ming Li reunion, the two became lovers.
sentences.chinese: 星进学成归国，与明莉重逢，两人成了恋人。

sentences.english: Home visits when the meet again tears demobilization yes, yes right mother's thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 探家复员时重逢的泪水是，是对母亲的思念。

sentences.english: Sasaki-san sees a neighbour for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 泰子遇到了她的邻居，这是她们震后第一次重逢。

sentences.english: It was a family reunion for Big Ben.
sentences.chinese: 这对大本来说是一次家庭重逢。

sentences.english: We went to "melody"to have a party with old friends last weekend.
sentences.chinese: 周末，因为旧友重逢，我们晚上去麦乐迪唱歌。

sentences.english: Artoo would be reunited with Anakin a decade later.
sentences.chinese: R2在十年后与阿纳金重逢。

sentences.english: Then, I ran into her last year while attending an annual convention at the University.
sentences.chinese: 然后，去年我在加入黉舍年会时重逢了她。

sentences.english: It is to hope to take an examination of Beijing philharmonic, 2 it is meet again of Chen Ya of become reconciled brother.
sentences.chinese: 一是希望考入北京交响乐团，二是和好兄弟陈亚重逢。

sentences.english: UK couple reunited 65 years after they were split during WWII.
sentences.chinese: 近日，英国一对恋人在分离65年后重逢并结婚。

sentences.english: Nowadays, in former days lover meet again, do not have flavor one time to be in mind.
sentences.chinese: 如今，昔日恋人重逢，别有一番滋味在心头。

sentences.english: Then they had a little celebration on finding each other.
sentences.chinese: 于是，他们先庆祝了一下久别重逢。

sentences.english: And in dreams and reveries, haven’t I revisited him countless times?
sentences.chinese: 在梦幻中，我难道没有多次与他重逢？

sentences.english: People feel especially drawn to one another when they have been reunited after many years of separation.
I am still digesting our reunion and will be for quite some time.
sentences.chinese: 我仍在慢慢消化我们的重逢，这要花上一段时间。

definition: to see each other/to meet in person
to meet again after a long period of separation
to leave (on a long journey)/to part from sb
meet by chance/have a chance encounter
to know each other/to recognize/to identify/to acknowledge (an old relationship)
(of relatives or friends) to live far apart from each other
to bid farewell/to part (usually with little hope of meeting again)
